metadata.feature_description: Control post visibility with different privacy levels

steps.expected: Activity Feed page loads with post area visible
steps.actual: Activity Feed page loaded successfully with 'Tell the world something...' post area

steps.action: Click on post area and open privacy menu
steps.expected: Privacy menu should appear with privacy options
steps.actual: Privacy menu opened showing 4 options: Everyone, Community Members, Friends, Private

steps.action: Select Everyone privacy option and enter post text
steps.actual: Everyone option selected (default) and text entered: 'Privacy test - Everyone visibility - Jan 16 2026'

steps.expected: Post should be created and appear in feed
steps.actual: Post created successfully and appeared at top of feed

steps.action: Click on post area and select Community Members privacy
steps.expected: Community Members option should be selectable
steps.actual: Community Members privacy option selected successfully

steps.action: Enter post text and click Share
steps.expected: Post with Community privacy should be created
steps.actual: Post created successfully: 'Privacy test - Community Members visibility - Jan 16 2026'

steps.action: Click on post area and select Friends privacy
Enter post text and click Share
steps.expected: Post with Friends privacy should be created
steps.actual: Post created successfully: 'Privacy test - Friends visibility - Jan 16 2026'

steps.action: Click on post area and select Private privacy
Enter post text and click Share
steps.expected: Post with Private privacy should be created
steps.actual: Post created successfully: 'Privacy test - Private visibility - Jan 16 2026'

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Create post with Group Members privacy

steps.action: Navigate to a Group Activity page (Test Activity Group)
steps.expected: Group activity page should load with group-specific privacy options
steps.actual: Group Activity page loaded with 3 privacy options: Everyone, Community Members, Group Members (default)

steps.action: Enter post text and click Share with Group Members privacy
steps.expected: Post with Group Members privacy should be created
steps.actual: Post created successfully: 'Privacy test - Group Members visibility - Jan 16 2026'

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify post visibility for different user types

steps.action: Review code to understand privacy enforcement logic
steps.expected: Privacy settings should be enforced at the API/database level
steps.actual: Code review confirmed: ActivityStreamServicesController.cs contains HasInvalidSecuritySet() method that validates SecuritySet values (E=Everyone, C=Community, F=Friends, U=Private, R=Group Members). Privacy is enforced server-side when creating posts.

steps.action: Look for edit/change privacy option on existing posts
steps.expected: There should be an option to change privacy settings after posting
steps.actual: Post options include: Like, Comment, Subscribe/Unsubscribe, Remove, Pin/Unpin. No Edit option found to change privacy after posting.

issues: Privacy cannot be changed after a post is created - no Edit functionality available for posts

steps.action: Click Comment on a privacy-restricted post (Private visibility)
steps.expected: Comment area should appear without its own privacy dropdown
steps.actual: Comment area appeared with text input, Reply and Cancel buttons, and attachment icons. No privacy dropdown for comments - confirming comments inherit parent post's privacy.

steps.action: Compare privacy options on profile page vs group page
steps.expected: Privacy options should vary by context
steps.actual: Profile page shows 4 options (Everyone, Community Members, Friends, Private). Group page shows 3 options (Everyone, Community Members, Group Members). Friends/Private options not available in groups; Group Members option only available in groups.

observations: The privacy menu is hidden by default (display:none) and requires JavaScript interaction to make visible. This may be a UI/UX issue where users might not discover the privacy settings easily.
Privacy options are context-dependent: Profile pages offer Everyone/Community/Friends/Private, while Group pages offer Everyone/Community/Group Members.
There is no ability to edit post privacy after creation - the only post management options are Like, Comment, Subscribe, Remove, and Pin.
Comments do not have their own privacy settings - they inherit the privacy level of the parent post.
Verifying actual post visibility enforcement for different user types would require logging in as multiple different users (non-friends, non-community-members, etc.), which is complex setup.
The code in ActivityStreamServicesController.cs shows server-side validation of SecuritySet values (E, C, F, U, R) to prevent invalid privacy settings.
